bug.title: public-server option broken with new ipython
bug.body: IPython has been updated and the --public-server option no longer works. the symptom is IPython spins forever trying to start, and the following appears on the console: IPython-stderr>WARNING:tornado.access:403 GET /api/kernels/... this change: https://github.com/ipython/ipython/commit/600762a669331a4cb5fcdcedfe6da1df655aa986 to the zmq handlers for the websockets makes the CORS checking more strict. it compares the protocols in addition to the host and port. with the pubilc-server option, one is https and the other is http. why does this bite us? not sure, possibly this involves: https://github.com/twosigma/beaker-notebook/blob/master/plugin/ipythonPlugins/src/dist/vendor/ipython2/kernel.js#L129 or more likely https://github.com/twosigma/beaker-notebook/blob/master/core/src/main/java/com/twosigma/beaker/core/rest/PluginServiceLocatorRest.java#L87 should say "http" instead of $scheme.

bug.title: new Stdout/err panel missing resize handle
bug.body: The old output panel had a border that you could grab and resize it larger or smaller. This is an important feature missing from the new one and we need to bring it back.

bug.title: many entries missing from Notebook menu
bug.body: ![screen shot 2014-08-31 at 10 46 36 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/963093/4102177/ab3a8a4c-311d-11e4-961f-d99d7ecd4a47.png) eg Show stdout/err, Delete all output cells, etc.

bug.title: Insert cell menu is confusing
bug.body: I don't think people will realize that two different actions are possible. The button looks like a normal ComboBox, which has only one action. I'd guess that people who haven't seen Beaker before will just click on the big part and never realize that there are other types of cells you can insert.

bug.title: Remove "New" from insert cell menu
bug.body: Every submenu is labeled "New *". The new is redundant and distracting.

bug.title: Html should be HTML
bug.body: ![screen shot 2014-08-28 at 10 51 32 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/963093/4085928/a4db9a1c-2f27-11e4-86e0-2b921dc200df.png)

bug.title: update default notebook
bug.body: "will turn light blue when plugin loads successfully" not anymore how about ``` # type some python on the next line and click "Run" to evaluate it and display the result. for example, try: 1+1 ```

bug.title: start backends lazily
bug.body: right now starting beaker is slower than starting my native, single-language system because it always loads R and ipython, even if you use only one or neither. if we fix the plugin manager so reclicking a plugin disables it and deletes it from the notebook, then it would be possible for a user to do that, remove the language(s) they don't use, and then save the result as the default notebook. i think that's too much work -- it should just do the right thing out of the box for naive users, and that means it doesn't start a python backend until you use it. that means the default notebook is more empty. the problem remaining is that the add cell menu will be empty, but it should be populated with all available backends (verified working on this instance, saved as a pref).

bug.title: locking notebook breaks section toggle
bug.body: 1) open a new notebook. put in some code and evaluate some of the cells. 2) lock the notebook. 3) click the section toggle on "hello beaker" 4) try to click it again -- you can't! 5) and very strangely, the checkmark next to lock also vanishes.

bug.title: Need easier way to tell if a cell is 'initialization cell' in new UI design
bug.body: Right now, one can click to open the cell menu and see if the 'initialization cell' item is checked or not. In the previous version of the UI, one can tell by the cell bracket color. before ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1767921/3891367/474d9036-2229-11e4-838f-9094a32d8f5f.png) after ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1767921/3891374/546f56a0-2229-11e4-9416-ebafd92db75d.png)

bug.title: Show language plugin indicator on code cells in 'Advanced mode'
bug.body: In Advanced mode, right now there is no easy way to tell which language was used for a particular code cell.

bug.title: Can't add new cells after deleting everything from the notebook
loading JS files confuses the module system
bug.body: See https://github.com/twosigma/beaker-notebook/issues/421 basically if JS in a cell calls loadJS or loadList, and the loaded code tries to define a module, it will fail to load. probably these function should do the define = undefined trick.

bug.title: html cell with script tag blows up sharing
bug.body: make a notebook with an HTML cell with a script tag like this: ![screen shot 2014-07-30 at 5 54 32 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/963093/3756989/376d360c-1834-11e4-94c4-b14545c15ccd.png) and then share the notebook. you get a result like this: http://sharing.beakernotebook.com/gist/anonymous/0f2970e8247fdb8a1d3d which looks like: ![screen shot 2014-07-30 at 5 56 10 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/963093/3757010/6bcfc3a6-1834-11e4-9e2f-3d5c22570f80.png)

bug.title: Mac OS X 10.7.5 - Beaker 0.55 missing nib file?
bug.body: The application won't launch for me. When run from the command line: localhost:MacOS user$ ./Beaker 2014-07-25 14:04:26.601 Beaker[12959:707] Unable to load nib file: MainMenu, exiting

bug.title: d3 example in tutorial cannot be shared
bug.body: in the tutorial notebook, if you run the last example the one that creates a bar chart with d3, it works but the results cannot be saved or shared because they exist only in the DOM not in the notebook model. ie you get http://sharing.beakernotebook.com/gist/anonymous/d2762331494b8ddc4953 and it says "chart will appear here" but in fact when i did the share, the chart was visible. we should figure out how to get the chart into the notebook model.

bug.title: update install docs to include new R packages
bug.body: there are developer docs and user docs. dev docks updated on merge, user docs on release. this bug is mostly about for the 1.0 release. They are: ``` RCurl RJSONIO devtools ```

bug.title: bundled nginx fails on old macs
bug.body: I was excited to see a new Beaker available that removed the requirement for all the dependencies given my previous problems (which i believed were down to my local setup as i couldn't replicate). I downloaded the DMG from the download page and started the app. Chrome launches but then says it can't connect to http://127.0.0.1:8801 Performing an lsof -a :8801 shows there are no processes connected to that port. Interestingly if i do an lsof -a :8802 I can see the java processes for beaker running, but an attempt to connect to http://127.0.0.1:8802 prompts for a username/password that I don't know. It looks as though nginx is crashing? Console shows the following messages: ``` 22/07/2014 22:22:07.321 gkbisd[156]: Unable to collect cdhash for /Applications/Beaker.app (error code 100024) 22/07/2014 22:22:07.401 Beaker[37031]: Beaker App start JVM and launch browser 22/07/2014 22:22:09.747 Beaker[37031]: running nginx: ./nginx/bin/nginx -p /Users/matt/.beaker/v1/nginx2945379141412575519 -c /Users/matt/.beaker/v1/nginx2945379141412575519/conf/nginx.conf 22/07/2014 22:22:09.873 Beaker[37031]: [main] INFO org.eclipse.jetty.server.Server - bug.title: JS plugin shows string result without quotes
bug.body: http://sharing.beakernotebook.com/gist/anonymous/3f7b8ba6bed6ac3e9343

bug.title: Bug in open notebook with uri type
bug.body: When opening a notebook with uri type that is not file or http, beaker fails to open it.

bug.title: command line parameters broken on mac
bug.body: eg: ``` $ /Users/spot/beaker-notebook/launcher/mac/Beaker\ rc2.app/Contents/Resources/dist/beaker.command --help bash: ./build/install/core/bin/core--help: No such file or directory ```

bug.title: mac native launcher requires OS X 10.9
bug.body: it refuses to run on 10.8. http://www.cocoawithlove.com/2009/09/building-for-earlier-os-versions-in.html

bug.title: redirect returned for remote login may be bad
bug.body: it uses the hostname but if DNS does not know about it others will not be able to connect. this happens on my home network for example, where I have no DNS. just substitute the IP# and it works but would be nice to use the name if it exists, ie get it from client.

bug.title: on windows file save gets confused
bug.body: ![beakerbug](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/963093/3553223/50d8f546-0901-11e4-8ee8-37b67aea91b0.png) i went to save a new notebook and clicked the middle of the 3 filesystem browsers, then clicked it again. the path gets duplicated at the bottom of the dialog

bug.title: README duplicated at top level and core/README.md
bug.body: should remove the one in core or just have it say something about contents of that subproject.

bug.title: Long term memory leak in notebook editor
bug.body: Here is the timeline of the memory usage while sitting on the notebook page. As you can see when the page does get garbage collected it still is trending upwards. ![](http://dl.dropbox.com/u/36928599/Screenshots/0dq.png)

bug.title: Significant memory issues
bug.body: Leaving beaker up and running for an extended period of time starts to peg out my CPU. ![](http://dl.dropbox.com/u/36928599/Screenshots/0dp.png)

bug.title: Elapsed timer will not end
bug.body: I ran a Python cell that never finished executing and the elapsed timer has just continued to count up, it's been going for 20 hours now. I have attempted to interrupt the process but it has not worked. Interrupting other cells within the notebook works. I can re-run the cell and receive the results I expect, but once I refresh the notebook the timer returns and continues counting. ![screen shot 2014-06-24 at 2 41 03 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/5454235/3375884/230f987a-fbcf-11e3-8eae-f4a807b321f2.png)

bug.title: NPE in getIPythonPassword
bug.body: [qtp330615170-22] WARN org.eclipse.jetty.servlet.ServletHandler - /rest/plugin-services/getIPythonPassword java.lang.NullPointerException at com.twosigma.beaker.core.rest.PluginServiceLocatorRest$PluginConfig.access$200(PluginServiceLocatorRest.java:661) at com.twosigma.beaker.core.rest.PluginServiceLocatorRest.getIPythonPassword(PluginServiceLocatorRest.java:658)

bug.title: Markdown cell contents are cleared when they are moved "up" in cell order.
bug.body: This problem does not happen when you move the cells down however.

bug.title: race condition in JS plugin
bug.body: sometimes the JS plugin does not load and the cell in the default notebook does not turn pink. this is quite rare during normal development but it seems more likely when our test suite runs on ubuntu.

bug.title: iruby broken
bug.body: on fresh ubuntu 14.04 build: ``` Running: /home/beaker/beaker-notebook/core/config/plugins/eval/ipythonPlugins/iruby/irubyPlugin 8807 8802 looking on stderr found:[ProfileCreate] Generating default config file: u'/home/beaker/.config/iruby/profile_default/ipython_config.py' looking on stderr found:[ProfileCreate] Generating default config file: u'/home/beaker/.config/iruby/profile_default/ipython_notebook_config.py' looking on stderr found:[ProfileCreate] Generating default config file: u'/home/beaker/.config/iruby/profile_default/ipython_nbconvert_config.py' looking on stderr found:/var/lib/gems/1.9.1/gems/iruby-0.1.9/lib/iruby/command.rb:90:in `symlink': File exists - (/var/lib/gems/1.9.1/gems/iruby-0.1.9/lib/iruby/static, /home/beaker/.config/iruby/profile_default/static) (Errno::EEXIST) looking on stderr found: from /var/lib/gems/1.9.1/gems/iruby-0.1.9/lib/iruby/command.rb:90:in `create_profile' looking on stderr found: from /var/lib/gems/1.9.1/gems/iruby-0.1.9/lib/iruby/command.rb:61:in `run_ipython' looking on stderr found: from /var/lib/gems/1.9.1/gems/iruby-0.1.9/lib/iruby/command.rb:17:in `run' looking on stderr found: from /var/lib/gems/1.9.1/gems/iruby-0.1.9/bin/iruby:6:in `<top (required)>' looking on stderr found: from /usr/local/bin/iruby:23:in `load' looking on stderr found: from /usr/local/bin/iruby:23:in `<main>' ```

bug.title: Language kernels don't re-establish lost websocket connections
bug.body: This is definitely true of iPython, probably other languages as well. If the websocket is terminated (like, server closes connection, you go offline for a second), the notebook will be permanently unusable until you refresh the page. This is only a real issue for cases where Beaker would need to be accessed over the internet, as when accessing beaker over loopback connection, not much could happen that would break the websocket connection.

bug.title: race conditions on windows
bug.body: and these may indicate larger problems that have not appeared yet on the other platforms. https://github.com/twosigma/beaker-notebook/blob/master/core/src/main/java/com/twosigma/beaker/core/rest/PluginServiceLocatorRest.java#L305 https://github.com/twosigma/beaker-notebook/blob/master/core/src/main/java/com/twosigma/beaker/core/rest/PluginServiceLocatorRest.java#L469

bug.title: Custom event binding needs to unbind to prevent detachedDOM nodes
bug.body: For instance these two methods are never unbound on `$destroy` thus causing a large memory leak across the lifespan of the application. The solution for this is to listen for `$destroy` and remove the listener, thus enabling the DOM node to be GCed. https://github.com/twosigma/beaker-notebook/blob/1e95a231ee1da6b84c95fbd2c0672c565d1954f4/core/src/main/web/app/mainapp/components/notebook/cell-directive.js#L152 https://github.com/twosigma/beaker-notebook/blob/1e95a231ee1da6b84c95fbd2c0672c565d1954f4/core/src/main/web/app/mainapp/components/notebook/cell-directive.js#L162

bug.title: file save dialog can go off the bottom of the window
bug.body: If you open a folder with a lot of subfolders or if you just make your window short, the bottom of the dialog, including the Open/Canel buttons goes off the bottom of the window and becomes inaccessible.

bug.title: Blank Screen on startup
bug.body: When I download the pre-compiled beaker notebook and run the beaker-command shell fire, chrome launches and i get a blank page. There are no error messages in the shell window. When I do a view source on the blank page I can see a valid HTML document, so i assume one of the Javascript files isn't working correctly. I then viewed the Javascript console and have the following error message: Failed to load resource: net::ERR_CONNECTION_REFUSED http://127.0.0.1:8801/beaker/rest/util/getInitPlugins I installed the pre-requisites by hand and built from source, and get a valid front page and am able to create the tutorial notebook. So must be something about how the pre-compiled version is packaged

bug.title: CTRL-A in tables should select all
bug.body: Currently, it selects the full notebook

bug.title: Memory leak opening notebooks
bug.body: Open the task manager and click 'file -> new' over and over. You'll see the memory for the tab increase by ~10mb each time. You can easily crash the UI with this by opening the tutorial a few times.

bug.title: New section header after a collapsed section header in wrong place
bug.body: If I create a new section header (S2) below a collapsed section header (S1), S2 is created between S1 and S1's children rather than after S1's children 1) create a new section header (S1) ``` [-] S1 ``` 2) add a code cell below S1 (C) ``` [-] S1 C ``` 3) collapse S1 ``` [+] S1 ``` 4) create a new section header (S2) (diagram for same level, any level works) ``` [+] S1 [-] S2 C ``` Expected result: ``` [+] S1 [-] S2 ``` Expanding S1: ``` [-] S1 C [-] S2 ```

bug.title: Expanding R error message turns it blank
bug.body: I typed some bad code in R and got an error message: ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4721419/2911906/deb2ee82-d669-11e3-9d85-9e3218aa19da.png) Pressing the [+] turned the error box blank: ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4721419/2911909/edbd27da-d669-11e3-95e7-da38a67c6975.png)

bug.title: Beaker hangs during close & save
bug.body: I tried to close an unsaved notebook, clicked Save, and the process is hung: ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4721419/2896353/0c7fe454-d56c-11e3-8bce-700f528a72a9.png) The in-browser instance of Beaker crashed ("aw, snap!" screen in Chrome) When I reopened Beaker, the file had correctly closed and saved.

bug.title: R not correctly suppressing output
bug.body: R is supposed to suppress the output of a command when: - assigning a value to a variable name - surrounding the command with invisible(...) e.g., the commands data1 <- 1:10 invisible(11:20) should return no output, as in R terminal: ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4721419/2896283/1e926a14-d56b-11e3-8102-af52bc2cc115.png) However, here is incorrect output in Beaker: ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4721419/2896289/2eb16da0-d56b-11e3-8612-ac725587582b.png) Oddly, if I assign a list to a variable name, then it is correctly suppressed: ![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4721419/2896290/34446358-d56b-11e3-9c9d-7206fbb5ee1a.png)

bug.title: Wordcloud notebook is mangled in sharing view
bug.body: Source notebook: http://jchendy.com/beaker/wordcloud.bkr Share: http://sharing.beakernotebook.com/gist/anonymous/11510698

bug.title: Default notebook contains fake settings for JavaScript
bug.body: https://github.com/twosigma/beaker-notebook/blob/master/core/config/default.bkr#L25 ``` "jsSetting2": "", "jsSetting1": "" ``` Presumably those are an artifact of some plugin testing we did long ago?

bug.title: Remove --pylab from our IPython startup script
bug.body: We've known for a while that this was deprecated, but now in the current master branch of IPython, the startup command will fail if --pylab is used. http://mail.scipy.org/pipermail/ipython-dev/2014-April/013824.html

bug.title: you can add a plugin multiple times and they come out the the same name
When loading a plugin from a cross-origin URL, show a dialog warning the user that it could be unsafe
bug.body: Currently, plugins are automatically loaded. If it's coming from a cross-origin URL, this is a potential security issue. A minimal step toward address this is to present a dialog asking the user to confirm the loading of cross-origin URLs. This is part of #142.

bug.title: remove bogus jsSettings
bug.body: https://github.com/twosigma/beaker-notebook/search?q=jssetting1&ref=cmdform jssetting1 and jssetting2 are not used they are leftover test code i think.

bug.title: Section Headers break on some chars
bug.body: like enter and < the get html encoded but the tags show up and then get re-encoded.

bug.title: nginx process not killed on Windows
bug.body: I've run Beaker a few times by clicking on 'beaker.command' and killed it by closing the command windows that pop up. When I start again, it reports that all the ports are still used. See the screenshot: ![screen shot 2014-04-01 at 11 23 21 am](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1740497/2580805/96fba90a-b9b1-11e3-996d-19c5f9fbd64c.png) If I try to reconnect to one of the old URLs, I get a 404 from nginx.

bug.title: python cells cannot display latex
bug.body: ``` from IPython.core.display import display_latex display_latex('$$x/y$$', raw=True) ``` does not work. need to identify this as bkoLatex. but the real problem is that we do not handle multiple results from python, right now we force them to html. they should be encapsulated in an OutputContainer. ie this should work too: ``` from IPython.core.display import display_latex, display_html display_latex('$$x/y$$', raw=True) display_html('boldtext', raw=True) ```

bug.title: Possible race condition about port availability checking and occupying
bug.body: As pointed out by @dmitri-at-twosigma: https://github.com/twosigma/beaker-notebook/pull/86#discussion-diff-10724105R177 right now we check the availability of a port and then use it in a non-atomic way.

bug.title: Support IPython Latex display
bug.body: The following should all work in Python. None of them currently do. ``` from IPython.display import Latex Latex("$x_i$") ``` ``` from IPython.display import Math Math(r'x_i') ``` ``` %%latex $x_i$ ```

bug.title: julia RDatasets won't load
bug.body: on ubuntu Pkg.add("RDatasets") produces ERROR: failed process: Process(`sh -c 'cd /home/sheep/.julia/v0.2/.cache/RDatasets && git rev-parse --git-dir'`, ProcessExited(128)) [128] in pipeline_error at process.jl:476 in readbytes at process.jl:430 in readall at process.jl:437 in dir at git.jl:12 in git at git.jl:18 in cmd at git.jl:23 in run at git.jl:24 in set_remote_url at git.jl:96 in prefetch at pkg/cache.jl:40 in resolve at pkg/entry.jl:341 in resolve at pkg/entry.jl:316 in edit at pkg/entry.jl:24 in add at pkg/entry.jl:44 in add at pkg/entry.jl:48 in anonymous at pkg/dir.jl:28 in cd at file.jl:22 in cd at pkg/dir.jl:28 in add at pkg.jl:19

bug.title: Show an error and installation instructions when plugin loading fails
bug.body: Loading currently fails silently. We should notify the user of problems and help them fix it.

bug.title: Notify user on save errors
bug.body: 1) Make a new notebook 2) File -> Save 3) Enter "/asdf" and click save You'll get an exception in the console but no feedback within Beaker. (Assuming you're not root)

bug.title: Reopening the same notebook doesn't work
bug.body: 1) Open the tutorial 2) Click Help -> Tutorial notebook again The tutorial should reload, but it doesn't. The same problem happens if you load something with File -> recent and then try the same thing again.

bug.title: Make able to update old default notebook and config file
bug.body: Currently, the default notebook and config file sitting in the dot dir will not be updated once created. This prevents the newer version of default notebook and config to be deployed. We should apply version converter to update the old format files while preserving any user changes(maybe manual).

bug.title: R plugin missing interrupt
bug.body: you can't stop an infinite loop

bug.title: IPython autocomplete sometime doesn't work
bug.body: for example try to complete this code: open('/Users/') by moving the cursor to between / and ' (at the end of "/Users"), hit Ctrl+space, it becomes something like: open('//Users/alee/) while expected result should be: open('/Users/alee/')

bug.title: stdout scrolls past bottom of the screen
